monogr.title: A concordance or table made after the order of the alphabet : conteyning the principall both wordes & matters, which are comprehended in the newe Testament, gathered by T.W
monogr.author: T. W. (Thomas Wilcox)

div.head: TO THE READ ••
div.p: THis Table folowing, was for thy 〈…〉 (good Christian reader) taken in hand, 〈◊〉 through Gods goodnes perfourmed & accomplished, as thou seest. For the better vnderstanding whereof, thou art diligently to remember, that such titles as concerne the sense and meaning of the Scripture, are marked thus ✿. Such as respect Doctrine, eyther touching fayth, or maners, are marked thus ♣. As for the proper names of men, places &c. they haue no note at all set before them. So that thou maiest easelie knowe (by holding the notes and markes) to discerne, yea, to referre euery point herein comprehended, to his right end and purpose. Furthermore, this also hath bene obserued on thy behalfe, that looke whatsoeuer titles beginne with one worde, though perhappes they conteyne seuerall & diuers matters, yet they are included thus [. The Lord remoue al our sinnes, as farre from vs, as the East is from the West, that by that meanes through his special blessing, this and all other good labors, attempted for the instruction of his children, may (in these ignorant daies, and doting olde age of the worlde) become fruitfull, so that our inward man may growe vp in all holy knowledge, and spirituall vnderstanding, and we expresse the fruites of blessed obedience in our liues and conuersation, till we come at the last to reape that eternall perfection, which he hath reserued to giue vnto vs in the last day, through Christ Iesus our Lord, & onely Sauiour. So be it.
